hints.content: Start by understanding how the vertical bars '|' group the characters in the string. Each pair of '|' defines a section of the string where asterisks '*' should be excluded from the count.
Consider how you can traverse the string. You might want to keep track of whether you are currently inside a pair of vertical bars or outside of them.
You can use a simple counter to keep track of the number of asterisks '*' you encounter. Make sure to only increment this counter when you are outside of any '|' pairs.
Think about how you can identify when you've entered and exited a pair of '|' characters. You might want to use a boolean flag or a counter to track your state.
As you iterate through the string, toggle your state (inside or outside of '|' pairs) every time you encounter a '|'. This way, you can easily manage when to count asterisks.
Remember to initialize your counter to zero before starting to iterate through the string. This will ensure you start counting asterisks from a clean state.
Consider edge cases, such as when the string has no asterisks or when all asterisks are enclosed within '|' pairs. How will your solution handle these scenarios?
When you find a '|', check if you are currently counting asterisks. If you are, stop counting until you find the next '|'.
After iterating through the string, ensure that you return the final count of asterisks. This should be the total count excluding any found between pairs of '|'.
To finalize your approach, think about how you will structure your loop. A single pass through the string is sufficient, so consider using a for loop to iterate through each character.

questionNotes: s consists of lowercase English letters, vertical bars '|', and asterisks '*'.
s contains an even number of vertical bars '|'.
Each '|' belongs to exactly one pair.
Return the count of '*' excluding those between pairs of '|'.
